job.name: Azure_Databricks_Create_Spark_Cluster

variable.description: The subscription id of your Microsoft Azure account.
variable.name: SUBSCRIPTION_ID

variable.description: The tenant id of your Microsoft Azure account.
variable.name: TENANT_ID

variable.description: ID of a Azure client application.
variable.name: APP_ID

variable.description: Secret key of the Azure client application.
variable.name: PASSWORD

variable.description: Hidden variable that contains the authentication endpoint of Azure REST API.
variable.name: AUTHENTICATION_ENDPOINT

variable.description: Hidden variable that contains the REST endpoint for managing Azure HDInsight clusters.
variable.name: MANAGEMENT_ENDPOINT

variable.description: The name of the Resource Group where Databricks resources will be created. If the value of this variable is changed, it must be also changed in the workflow 'Azure_Databricks_Delete_Spark_Cluster'
variable.name: RESOURCE_GROUP_NAME

variable.description: The region of Azure Cloud where the Resource Group will be created
variable.name: RESOURCE_GROUP_LOCATION

variable.description: Name of the Deployment for Databricks workspace. If the value of this variable is changed, it must be also changed in the workflows 'Azure_Databricks_Delete_Spark_Cluster'
variable.name: DEPLOYMENT_NAME

variable.description: Microsoft Azure ARM template (a JSON file), which is used to create the Databricks workspace. This file must be placed in the global data space.
variable.name: WORKSPACE_ARM_TEMPLATE

variable.description: Name of the Databricks workspace to be deployed
variable.name: WORKSPACE_NAME

variable.description: Pricing model of Databricks resources
variable.name: WORKSPACE_PRICING_TIER

variable.description: Name of the Spark cluster to be created.
variable.name: SPARK_CLUSTER_NAME

variable.description: Version of the Spark cluster to be created.
variable.name: SPARK_VERSION

variable.description: Type/size of the nodes of the Spark cluster.
variable.name: SPARK_NODE_TYPE

variable.description: If set to "true", Spark performs speculative execution of tasks. This means if one or more tasks are running slowly in a stage, they will be re-launched.
variable.name: SPARK_SPECULATION

variable.description: Boolean value indicating whether the autoscaling feature (of the Databricks Spark cluster) is activated or not.
variable.name: AUTOSCALING

variable.description: Number of Spark workers (to be used when the autoscaling feature is set to false).
variable.name: NUMBER_OF_WORKERS

variable.description: Minimal number of Spark workers (to be used when the autoscaling feature is set to true).
variable.name: MIN_WORKERS

variable.description: Maximal number of Spark workers (to be used when the autoscaling feature is set to true).
variable.name: MAX_WORKERS

variable.description: SPEL expression handling the variables to show with respect to the autoscaling setting.
variable.model: PA:SPEL(variables['AUTOSCALING'] == 'false' ? showVar('NUMBER_OF_WORKERS') && hideVar('MIN_WORKERS') && hideVar('MAX_WORKERS') : hideVar('NUMBER_OF_WORKERS') && showVar('MIN_WORKERS') && showVar('MAX_WORKERS'))
variable.name: AUTOSCALING_HANDLER

job.description: A workflow that uses Azure REST API to create a Databricks Spark Cluster. It requires two groups of inputs: (i) Azure subscription parameters and (ii) Databricks deployment parameters. In particular, it requires as input the variable `WORKSPACE_ARM_TEMPLATE`, which takes as value an Azure ARM template for deploying a Databricks workspace. A ready-to-use template called "Azure\_Databricks/Azure\_Databricks\_Workspace\_ARM\_Template.json" is provided in the global dataspace. The workflow customizes the ARM template with respect to the provided input variables. Once the Spark cluster is deployed successfully, the workflow exposes three actions/signals that allow users to: (i) Submit Spark jobs, (ii) Resize the cluster and (iii) Delete the Spark cluster and all associated resources.

task.name: deploy_databricks_workspace
task.description: A task performing a PUT request to Azure REST API, in order to deploy a Databricks Workspace, which name is given as input. This task requires the Azure authentication token provided by the task "ad_token_for_azure_resources".

variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.
variable.name: ENDPOINT

variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)
variable.name: PATH

variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification
variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK

variable.description: Content-Type of the request
variable.name: CONTENT_TYPE

variable.description: A JSON parameter containing the request body.
variable.name: REQUEST_BODY

variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.
variable.name: DEBUG

variable.description:
Format of the response, either:
  • string: plain text
  • json: a json response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • xml: a xml response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • html
    • : an html response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • contentView: the response will be stored in raw format, and the response content-type will be used for previewing (suitable for binary formats such as files, images, pdf documents, etc)
variable.name: RESPONSE_FORMAT

variable.description: Which data to extract in the response if json, xml or html format is selected. It uses the GPath notation
variable.name: RESPONSE_PATH

variable.description: HTTP Authorization request header that contains the credentials to authenticate the user to the server
variable.name: HEADER_Authorization

script.code:
def jarFile = new File(cachespace, "rest-assured-fat-3.3.0.jar")
forkEnvironment.addAdditionalClasspath(jarFile.getAbsolutePath())

task.name: ad_token_for_azure_resources
task.description: A task performing a POST request to Azure REST API in order to authenticate to Azure and acquire an authentication token.

variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.
variable.name: ENDPOINT

variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)
variable.name: PATH

variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification
variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK

variable.description: Content-Type of the request
variable.name: CONTENT_TYPE

variable.description: A JSON parameter containing the request body.
variable.name: REQUEST_BODY

variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.
variable.name: DEBUG

variable.description:
Format of the response, either:
  • string: plain text
  • json: a json response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • xml: a xml response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • html
    • : an html response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • contentView: the response will be stored in raw format, and the response content-type will be used for previewing (suitable for binary formats such as files, images, pdf documents, etc)
variable.name: RESPONSE_FORMAT

variable.description: Which data to extract in the response if json, xml or html format is selected. It uses the GPath notation
variable.name: RESPONSE_PATH

script.code:
def jarFile = new File(cachespace, "rest-assured-fat-3.3.0.jar")
forkEnvironment.addAdditionalClasspath(jarFile.getAbsolutePath())

import groovy.json.*
// =========== Manage Azure Access token ============ def slurper = new JsonSlurper() jsonData = slurper.parseText(JsonOutput.toJson(result))
access_token=jsonData.access_token variables.put("ACCESS_TOKEN",access_token) println variables.get("ACCESS_TOKEN")
expires_on=jsonData.expires_on variables.put("EXPIRES_ON",expires_on) println variables.get("EXPIRES_ON")

task.name: check_databricks_workspace_deployment
task.description:
A task performing a Get request to Azure REST API in order to check the status of the workspace deployment, which name is given as input. This task is executed iteratively (an iteration per minute) until the deployment is finished.
This task requires the Azure authentication token provided by the task "ad_token_for_azure_resources".

task.name: prepare_arm_template_params
task.description: A groovy task that customizes the Databricks Workspace ARM template, based on the parameters given as input by the user. These parameters are: (i) WORKSPACE_NAME and (ii) WORKSPACE_PRICING_TIER.

script.code:
import groovy.json.*
jsonFile = new File(variables.get("WORKSPACE_ARM_TEMPLATE"))
def jsonSlurper = new JsonSlurper() jsonData = jsonSlurper.parse(jsonFile)
jsonData.properties.template.parameters.project.defaultValue = "activeeon-databricks-project-"+variables.get("PA_JOB_ID") jsonData.properties.template.parameters.environment.defaultValue = "activeeon-databricks-env-"+variables.get("PA_JOB_ID") jsonData.properties.template.parameters.workspaceName.defaultValue = variables.get("WORKSPACE_NAME") jsonData.properties.template.parameters.pricingTier.defaultValue = variables.get("WORKSPACE_PRICING_TIER")
def modifiedJson = JsonOutput.prettyPrint(JsonOutput.toJson(jsonData)) variables.put("WORKSPACE_ARM_CONTENT",modifiedJson) println modifiedJson

task.name: create_databricks_spark_cluster
task.description:
A task performing a POST request to Azure Databricks REST API, in order to deploy a Databricks Spark cluster.
This task requires the Azure authentication token provided by the task "ad_token_for_azure_databricks".

variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.
variable.name: ENDPOINT

variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification
variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK

variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.
variable.name: DEBUG

variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)
variable.name: PATH

variable.description: Content-Type of the request, should be "application/json" with eventual encoding.
variable.name: CONTENT_TYPE

variable.description: A JSON parameter containing the request body.
variable.name: REQUEST_BODY

variable.description:
Format of the response, either:
  • string: plain text
  • json: a json response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • xml: a xml response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • html
    • : an html response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • contentView: the response will be stored in raw format, and the response content-type will be used for previewing (suitable for binary formats such as files, images, pdf documents, etc)
variable.name: RESPONSE_FORMAT

variable.description: Which data to extract in the response if json, xml or html format is selected. It uses the GPath notation
variable.name: RESPONSE_PATH

variable.description: Additional headers of the request, provided as a JSON key/value structure. Headers can also be specified by adding HEADER_headername variables.
variable.name: HEADERS

script.code:
def jarFile = new File(cachespace, "rest-assured-fat-3.3.0.jar")
forkEnvironment.addAdditionalClasspath(jarFile.getAbsolutePath())

variables.put("SPARK_CLUSTER_ID",result)
LinkedHashMap resMap = [:] resMap.put("Dataricks Spark cluster ID",result) resMap.put("Dataricks Workspace Name",variables.get("WORKSPACE_NAME")) resMap.put("Dataricks Workspace URL",variables.get("DATABRICKS_WORKSPACE")) resultMap.putAll(resMap)
schedulerapi.connect() schedulerapi.addExternalEndpointUrl(variables.get("PA_JOB_ID"), "Azure Portal", "https://portal.azure.com/" , "/automation-dashboard/styles/patterns/img/wf-icons/azure_icon.png")

task.name: wait_for_user_action
task.description: A task that waits for a user action among the following actions: (i) Submit_Job_To_Spark_Cluster, (ii) Resize_Spark_Cluster and (iii) Undeploy_Databricks_Resources.

task.name: Continuation
task.description: A task that is executed after both the 'if' and 'else' branches. It allows for executing the loop that manages user actions.

script.code:
signalAction=variables.get("SIGNAL_ACTION")
loop = signalAction=="DELETE_DATABRICKS_RESOURCES" ? false : true
variables.put("SIGNAL_ACTION","")

task.name: submit_resize_or_deletion_and_wait
task.description: Submit a workflow referenced in the ProActive Catalog (or accessible by url) and wait for its termination by checking every minute if the job is terminated.

variable.description: The workflow (in ProActive catalog) to be executed when the action 'Undeploy_Databricks_Resources' is triggered.
variable.name: DELETE_DATABRICKS_RESOURCES_WORKFLOW

variable.description: The workflow (in ProActive catalog) to be executed when the action 'Resize_Spark_Cluster' is triggered.
variable.name: RESIZE_CLUSTER_WORKFLOW

script.code: if(variables.get("SIGNAL_ACTION")=="DELETE_DATABRICKS_RESOURCES"){//Remove External Endpoint Url schedulerapi.connect() schedulerapi.removeExternalEndpointUrl(variables.get("PA_JOB_ID"), "Azure Portal") }

task.name: submit_spark_job_no_wait
task.description: Submit a workflow referenced in the ProActive Catalog (or accessible by url) without waiting for its termination

variable.description: The workflow (in ProActive catalog) to be executed when the action 'Submit_Job_To_Spark_Cluster' is triggered.
variable.name: SUBMIT_SPARK_JOB_WORKFLOW

A task performing a Get request to Azure Databricks REST API in order to check the status of the Spark cluster deployment, which name is given as input. This task is executed iteratively (an iteration per minute) until the deployment is finished.
This task requires the Azure authentication token provided by the task "ad_token_for_azure_databricks".

task.name: azure-get-workspace-url
task.description:
A task performing a rest GET request to Azure REST API, in order to acquire the Databricks Workspace URL based on the Workspace name (given as input).
This task requires the Azure authentication token provided by the task "ad_token_for_azure_resources".

variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.

variables.put("DATABRICKS_WORKSPACE",result)

task.name: prepare_cluster_json_payload
task.description: A groovy task that prepares the JSON payload needed for the deployment of the Databricks Spark cluster, based on the parameters given as input by the user. These parameters are: SPARK_CLUSTER_NAME, SPARK_VERSION, SPARK_NODE_TYPE, SPARK_SPECULATION, AUTOSCALING, NUMBER_OF_WORKERS, MIN_WORKERS and MAX_WORKERS.
